newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian lev ends softer on rise in dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian lev ends softer on rise in dollar demand.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev eased to 366-367 per dollar at the close on the local interbank market from 362-364 in the morning due to a rise in foreign currency demand from a final client, dealers said.
"A large fuel importer was bidding for a total of $2-3 million but supply was relatively low," a commercial bank dealer said.
The central bank was not seen offering dollars in the market to meet part of the demand and the client was serviced by commercial banks, traders said.
Central bank officials were not available for comment. -- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-876032
